Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of frieze of geese walking right (beak of first goose; back end, wing and legs of second); pendant triangle, hooked swastika and dotted rosettes as filling ornament; below, line and zigzag.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 235, no. 149, pl.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0155) (phase 2)
